content:
• Monday, February 11, 2013
  • NCLH

    Norwegian Cruise Line (NASDAQ:NCLH): posts a mixed Q4, missing top line estimates but beating on...

    Norwegian Cruise Line (NASDAQ:NCLH): posts a mixed Q4, missing top line estimates but beating on a per share basis on from higher yields from both passenger ticket and onboard and other revenue. The company also ups guidance, now expecting its Q1 EPS in the range of of $0.02 - $0.05 versus the consensus estimate of a $0.01 loss. For FY13, it sees an EPS of $1.20 - $1.40, versus the average estimate of $1.26. Shares +4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST): Q3 loss beats consensus estimates as revenue jumps 21% Y/Y....

    Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST): Q3 loss beats consensus estimates as revenue jumps 21% Y/Y. Revenues of $33.3 million were shy of estimates of $33.7 million, but higher than Q3 2011. Shipments grew to 26.1 megawatts, compared to 23.5 megawatts during the prior year period. Gross margin doubled from $2.3M to $4.6M, or 14% of revenue. Product backlog also increased to $136.5M, up 19% year-over-year. Shares +15.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • GTE

    Gran Tierra Energy (NYSEMKT:GTE) +9.1% AH on news of an oil discovery in Peru, where initial...

    Gran Tierra Energy (NYSEMKT:GTE) +9.1% AH on news of an oil discovery in Peru, where initial results indicate 99 ft. of gross oil column in the Bretaña Norte exploration well. GTE says the prospect contains substantial contingent resource potential. GTE also says it is in the process of completing the Moqueta-8 well in Colombia as a production well.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RXN +13%. GTE +9%. MAS +5%. NCLH +4%. BCOR +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RXN +13%. GTE +9%. MAS +5%. NCLH +4%. BCOR +3%.
    After-hours top losers: AMSC -8%. ORIG -5%. NTI -5%. MTGE -3%. GMED -3%.

  • ORIG

    Ocean Rig UDW (NASDAQ:ORIG) -4.5% AH after DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) reveals plans to sell 5M ORIG...

    Ocean Rig UDW (NASDAQ:ORIG) -4.5% AH after DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) reveals plans to sell 5M ORIG common shares it owns in a public offering. ORIG will receive no proceeds from the sale. This may not be the final share sale, as DRYS still is expected to own ~61.3% of ORIG’s outstanding shares after the offering. DRYS +0.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • MTGE

    American Capital Mortgage (NASDAQ:MTGE) sys it plans to make a public offering of 18M shares of...

    American Capital Mortgage (NASDAQ:MTGE) sys it plans to make a public offering of 18M shares of common stock. Management plans to use the proceeds toward mortgage-related investments. Barclays, Citigroup, Credit Suisse, Morgan Stanley and Wells Fargo Securities are acting as joint book-running managers. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • HCA

    HCA Holdings (NYSE:HCA) announces a secondary offering, saying that certain shareholders -...

    HCA Holdings (NYSE:HCA) announces a secondary offering, saying that certain shareholders - consisting principally of affiliates of Bain Capital Partners and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts - intend to sell around 50M shares of stock. No shares are being sold by management or the company. Barclays Capital and Citigroup will act as underwriters. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) -1.7% AH after receiving a downgrade to Market Perform from Bernstein. The...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) -1.7% AH after receiving a downgrade to Market Perform from Bernstein. The firm upgraded Facebook on Nov. 26 - shares are up 9% since then. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • TWTC

    TW Telecom (NASDAQ:TWTC): Q4 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $377.9M (+7.5% Y/Y) beats...

    TW Telecom (NASDAQ:TWTC): Q4 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $377.9M (+7.5% Y/Y) beats by $2.1M. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • AMSC

    More on American Superconductor: The company has received a new $30M order from wind turbine...

    More on American Superconductor: The company has received a new $30M order from wind turbine maker Inox. FQ4 guidance is for revenue of $18M+ and EPS above -$0.23 vs. a consensus of $25.8M and -$0.26. The FQ3 revenue miss is blamed on "delayed revenue recognition" from a Wind division client; no explanation for why FQ4 revenue guidance is also light. Wind division sales -33% Y/Y to $6.8M, Grid division +34% to $10.6M thanks to strong D-VAR sales. Gross margin was just 5.1%, but up from FQ2's 2.3%. AMSC -4.2% AH after rallying 10.6% in normal trading. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM

  • A big move late in the yen (FXY -1.2% in regular trade, -0.6% AH) takes the currency to its...

    A big move late in the yen (FXY -1.2% in regular trade, -0.6% AH) takes the currency to its weakest vs. the dollar in more than 2 years, the greenback now buying ¥94.32. The hedged Japan equity fund (DXJ) nods in approval, +2.4%. The Nikkei was closed Monday, but look for fireworks tonight. Earlier: The government drops all pretense and calls for Nikkei 13K by March 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 5 Comments

    Advanced Photonix (NYSEMKT:API): FQ3 EPS of -$0.02 in-line. Revenue of $5.8M (-10% Y/Y) misses...

    Advanced Photonix (NYSEMKT:API): FQ3 EPS of -$0.02 in-line. Revenue of $5.8M (-10% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M. Shares -17.4% AH. (PR)

    Kosmos Energy (NYSE:KOS) -2.8% AH after announcing a public offering of ~30M common shares to be offered by existing shareholders and certain officers of KOS. The company will receive no proceeds from the sale.

  • DS

    Hard not to see this one coming. After a big run in its stock price, Newcastle Investment (NCT)...

    Hard not to see this one coming. After a big run in its stock price, Newcastle Investment (NCT) announces a 20M share secondary, the proceeds of which will no doubt be put to work buying more MSRs. The offering will increase the float by about 12%. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • BNNY

    Annie's (NYSE:BNNY): Q4 EPS of $0.15 in-line. Adj. Net Revenue of $37.9M (+22.7% Y/Y) beats by...

    Annie's (NYSE:BNNY): Q4 EPS of $0.15 in-line. Adj. Net Revenue of $37.9M (+22.7% Y/Y) beats by $1.3M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ3 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $743.6M (+130% Y/Y)...

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ3 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $743.6M (+130% Y/Y) beats by $50.29M. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ATRO

    Astronics (ATRO +5%) closes out near its highs for the day after KeyBanc upped it to Buy earlier...

    Astronics (ATRO +5%) closes out near its highs for the day after KeyBanc upped it to Buy earlier with a $30 price target on the back of encouraging Q4 results an relief from a selling overhang that has pressured shares over the near term. The firm says it's built up confidence over the last several quarters in management's ability to fund elevated levels of R&D while sustaining solid margins relative to its peers in the space. Additionally, and the company's growth prospects, particularly in the business jet market, are compelling at current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • WFT

    Weatherford International (WFT -2.7%) faces "a charge of some magnitude" due to Venezuela's...

    Weatherford International (WFT -2.7%) faces "a charge of some magnitude" due to Venezuela's currency devaluation, Simmons analysts say. WFT had said it had $298M denominated in Venezuelan currency at the end of Q3, and that if the currency's value was slashed by 10%, it would have to record a charge of ~$30M. A 32% devaluation could triple that figure, significant for a company earning $77M in the quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • BVN

    Compañía de Minas Buenaventura's (BVN -4.4%) loss looks big even on a day when...

    Compañía de Minas Buenaventura's (BVN -4.4%) loss looks big even on a day when gold mining stocks are hit hard. It isn't just the drop in BVN’s stock price - its price swings also are getting wider, as its 30-day historical volatility has jumped 46% since Jan. 18 to 28%. BVN has dropped 21% YTD, far more than Newmont Mining (NYSE:NEM), its partner in Peru, and the gold miners ETF (NYSEARCA:GDX).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • HZNP

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP +5.2%) gets a boost today despite reporting disappointing preliminary Q4...

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP +5.2%) gets a boost today despite reporting disappointing preliminary Q4 and FY12 revenues. For the quarter, revenues were $6.7M, versus the consensus estimate of $8.04M. For FY12, revenues were $19.6M, also missing the consensus of $20.92M. Separately, the company also says it's commenced the full commercial launch of its prednisone delayed-release tablets to rheumatologists and high-value primary care physicians.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -2.7%) CEO Elon Musk blasts The New York Times in a series of tweets (I, II,...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -2.7%) CEO Elon Musk blasts The New York Times in a series of tweets (I, II, III) over its weekend test drive of the Model S which went rather poorly. In a nutshell, the exec blames user error for the mishaps and says he will line up more journalists to do the same drive. He also promises that more detailed info on charging data will be released on the Tesla blog. If Musk gives any detail on productions numbers in advance of the company's Q4 report, things could get really exciting.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 18 Comments
  • SVRA

    Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX -3%) says it's commenced dosing in its QT/QTc study of ANX-188....

    Adventrx Pharmaceuticals (ANX -3%) says it's commenced dosing in its QT/QTc study of ANX-188. The study will assess whether or not the drug has an effect on QT prolongation, which can potentially lead to malignant cardiac rhythm disturbances, as part of an FDA requirement to assess cardiac repolarization for most new drugs having systemic bioavailability. The dosing is expected to be completed in the first quarter, and results ae anticipated in the second quarter of 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • RDN

    Flush Radian (RDN -1.9%) shareholders (stock has tripled since the summer) use today's earnings...

    Flush Radian (RDN -1.9%) shareholders (stock has tripled since the summer) use today's earnings as an excuse to take some profits. The company missed on the headline number, but the mortgage insurance business is strong. On the earnings call, the company discloses $4B in new business in January, double 2 years ago, and expects FY2013 sales to surpass 2012 (3 hires last week). New defaults in January are off 28% Y/Y. (presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • ZN

    What's up at Zion Oil & Gas (ZN +26.4%)? Shares are skyrocketing despite no recent...

    What's up at Zion Oil & Gas (ZN +26.4%)? Shares are skyrocketing despite no recent update to account for the move, returning to levels seen before their late January selloff. At that time, ZN disclosed it is "in the process of re-evaluating our exploration strategy going forward."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • GEVA

    Synageva BioPharma (GEVA +0.9%) says the first patient has been initiated treatment in its Phase...

    Synageva BioPharma (GEVA +0.9%) says the first patient has been initiated treatment in its Phase 3 study of sebelipase alfa in children and adults with late onset lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Once fully initiated, the trial will enroll 50 child and adult patients with late onset LAL Deficiency.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +2.5%) moves up after saying that it's conducting a 6-month 500...

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +2.5%) moves up after saying that it's conducting a 6-month 500 subject open label study as part of an FDA requirement for Androxal, and it's sent a "request for guidance" letter to the agency regarding two other pivotal studies on the drug as well. Additionally, the company also says its requested an end of Phase 2 meeting before the end of April for its vaginal Proellex program for the treatment of uterine fibroids.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -2.8%) gives back some of last week's gains after Sony (SNE +0.5%) extends its...

    Netflix (NFLX -2.8%) gives back some of last week's gains after Sony (SNE +0.5%) extends its movie-licensing deal with Starz (STRZA +8.1%) to 2021. Stifel thinks the deal is likely in the $300M/year range, on par with the recent Netflix-Disney deal. With Starz having ended its relationship with Netflix specifically to keep its pay-TV industry customers happy, the odds of its content re-appearing on Netflix anytime soon are slim.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +5.8%) - yes, Zynga - is joining the ranks of Internet companies creating original...

    Zynga (ZNGA +5.8%) - yes, Zynga - is joining the ranks of Internet companies creating original programming. The company has hired Rush Hour director Bruce Ratner and studio Six Eleven Media to produce a series of 30-minute animated shows based on (wait for it...) FarmVille. Forbes' Paul Tassi, a long-time Zynga critic, is skeptical Zynga will reap major synergies, and also questions the show's appeal to adult FarmVille players. Shares are continuing their post-earnings rally today, perhaps lifted by rising online gambling hopes.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • GMCR

    Dougherty cuts its rating on Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4%) to Neutral from a...

    Dougherty cuts its rating on Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4%) to Neutral from a previous stance of Buy which was lined up just a few months ago when shares were below $25. Short interest in GMCR continues to trek lower, threatening to dip below 30M shares for the first time in eight months.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW -2.5%) slides after Barron's suggests shares could fall another 20%+ on top of their...

    VMware (VMW -2.5%) slides after Barron's suggests shares could fall another 20%+ on top of their post-earnings bludgeoning. The paper notes revenue growth has steadily decelerated over the last several years thanks to a saturating virtualization software market, and argues a forward P/E of 25 means shares are still expensive (ed: thanks to deferred revenue, VMware's price/free cash flow multiple is lower). The decline comes in spite of an upgrade to Overweight from Evercore. EMC -1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • PMC

    PharMerica (PMC -3.3%) dips as RBC Capital cuts the shares to Sector Perform on valuation...

    PharMerica (PMC -3.3%) dips as RBC Capital cuts the shares to Sector Perform on valuation following last weeks earnings report, saying that the nursing home pharmacy's reached it's $15 price target and coupled with declining sales, it doesn't see any incremental catalysts for growth over the near-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY -3.3%) continues to get whipsawed: Shares are giving back a portion of last...

    BlackBerry (BBRY -3.3%) continues to get whipsawed: Shares are giving back a portion of last week's big gains following news Home Depot has become the latest enterprise client to abandon the company; BlackBerry's U.S. corporate smartphone share has already fallen to a fraction of the iPhone's, thanks in part to the BYOD trend. The company announced this morning it will show off BB10's enterprise feature set at an event tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 25 Comments
  • ZN

    Midday top 10 gainers: OBT +37%. ZN +22%. MLNK +17%. OESX +14%. MDCI +13%. MCBC +13%. UNXL +11%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: OBT +37%. ZN +22%. MLNK +17%. OESX +14%. MDCI +13%. MCBC +13%. UNXL +11%. XRSC +11%. DMND +11%. IEP +11%.
    Midday top 10 losers: NVO -15%. GMXR -14%. OTC:DSKX -11%. ESTE -10%. AMBO -10%. CRVP -9%. ALCS -8%. GALT -8%. HEK -8%. BIOL -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • XONE

    ExOne (XONE +5.7%) is continuing its huge post-IPO surge. Shares are now up 77% from Thursday's...

    ExOne (XONE +5.7%) is continuing its huge post-IPO surge. Shares are now up 77% from Thursday's IPO price of $18. On Saturday, SA contributor Stone Fox Capital noted ExOne is dependent on a small number of sales of costly 3D printing systems sold to industrial clients: only 8 systems were sold in Q4, and just 5 in the first 9 months of the year. ExOne had a year-end backlog of 6 systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI +5%) is at levels last seen in August after Oppenheimer predicts the...

    Angie's List (ANGI +5%) is at levels last seen in August after Oppenheimer predicts the professional services site will benefit in 2013 from a housing recovery, improving margins, and a low valuation relative to peers. The remarks come ahead of Angie's Wednesday afternoon Q4 report. (Aug. 29 upgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • ELN

    Elan (ELN +1.1%) bounces back into the green after an early morning dip on the back of a UBS...

    Elan (ELN +1.1%) bounces back into the green after an early morning dip on the back of a UBS downgrade to Neutral. The firm cites a lack of visibility following its announcement that it's divesting a 50% stake in Tysabri to Biogen Idec (NASDAQ:BIIB). The price target is also lowered to $10.06.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • GNW

    Genworth (GNW +3.1%) is in talks to sell its wealth management business to two P-E firms,...

    Genworth (GNW +3.1%) is in talks to sell its wealth management business to two P-E firms, reports Reuters, with sources saying the deal would be valued at $400M-$450M. The business has been on the block since last fall, part of the company plan to raise capital and focus on its core business.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • MDCI

    Medical Action Industries (MDCI +16%) moves higher after its FQ4 bottom line blows out estimates...

    Medical Action Industries (MDCI +16%) moves higher after its FQ4 bottom line blows out estimates earlier this morning, overshadowing a miss in top line revenue. The surgical product supplier cites cost savings initiatives as a result of its restructuring into strategic business units begun in June 2012, plus an elimination of unprofitable sales and a reduction in raw material costs for the boost to margins. Gross profit was 17.5% of net sales, as compared to 15.2% in the prior quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • SPWR

    Solar stocks are having a good day (TAN +2.8%). One possible reason: a weekend FT report that...

    Solar stocks are having a good day (TAN +2.8%). One possible reason: a weekend FT report that observes bankers are close to securitizing solar panel leases into bonds. Functioning much like MBS', solar bonds would package panel leases and be supported by cash flows from related electricity purchase commitments. SPWR +9.8%. SOL +6.1%. YGE +6.5%. STP +5.5%. FSLR +5.5%. LDK +4.5%. JASO +4.5%. TSL +4.4%. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 4 Comments
  • AMGN

    Amgen (AMGN -1.3%) moves down as William Blair cuts the stock to Market Perform on valuation,...

    Amgen (AMGN -1.3%) moves down as William Blair cuts the stock to Market Perform on valuation, noting a lack of upcoming catalysts following a sustained move to the upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • CYH

    Community Health Systems (CYH -1.1%) trades lower after BMO cut its rating to Underperform on...

    Community Health Systems (CYH -1.1%) trades lower after BMO cut its rating to Underperform on valuation with a $35.00 price target. BMO says the stock has risen over 30% this year on the back of the Obamacare wave, but there are too many variables at play in FY14 to justify the move.  Additionally, managed care rates due to be released this week could "reignite investor concerns around government reimbursement and the real macro pressures affecting the space."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY -3.4%) dips after MLV cut the shares to Hold from Buy. The firm...

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY -3.4%) dips after MLV cut the shares to Hold from Buy. The firm says it prefers to take a cautious stance ahead of pending details of disease-modifying data from its lead partnered programs. One such program is its strategic alliance with The Medicines Co. (MDCO -3%) to develop ALN-PCS, an RNAi therapeutic program for the treatment of hypercholesterolemia.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • CSX

    A bullish piece in Barron's on the prospects for CSX (CSX +3%) appears to be tipping sentiment...

    A bullish piece in Barron's on the prospects for CSX (CSX +3%) appears to be tipping sentiment positive for several railroad sector peers. Though a boom in coal demand isn't expected, the rate of decline in shipments is already slowing and could reverse itself in the next year which bodes well for the railroad industry. Advancers: NSC +2.0%, CP +1.3%, UNP +1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY +3.4%) is rallying, possible aided by a GTM Research report that predicts huge...

    SolarCity (SCTY +3.4%) is rallying, possible aided by a GTM Research report that predicts huge growth in the market for residential solar leases. Thanks to arrangements such as those offered by SolarCity - free/low-cost panel installations in exchange for electricity purchase commitments - GTM sees the U.S. residential solar market growing to $5.7B in 2016 from $1.3B in 2012. However, the bulk of SolarCity's installations (on a MW basis) involve commercial clients.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • ALR

    Alere (ALR -4.9%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral at Wedbush this morning. Wedbush says the...

    Alere (ALR -4.9%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral at Wedbush this morning. Wedbush says the stock has had a good run as of late, up 28% over the past three months alone, and the unpredictability of calculating risk/reward based on "messy" prior quarters justifies a move to the sidelines as the company's due to report on Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • UNXL

    Uni-Pixel (UNXL +5.5%) trades higher after Williams Capital starts coverage with a Buy. Shares...

    Uni-Pixel (UNXL +5.5%) trades higher after Williams Capital starts coverage with a Buy. Shares of the touchscreen film developer have been range-bound in recent weeks following a huge October-January run-up. Q4 results arrive on Feb. 26.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • USAC

    Coverage of USA Compression Partners (USAC +2%) is initiated by at least four firms, including...

    Coverage of USA Compression Partners (USAC +2%) is initiated by at least four firms, including an Overweight rating from J.P. Morgan, which believes USAC's discounted valuation plus upper-single-digit distribution growth supported by strong organic growth initiatives will drive outperformance as the market gains comfort with its execution and assigns a valuation closer to peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • AUDC

    AudioCodes (AUDC +3.6%) is making new 52-week highs. The company announced this morning it has...

    AudioCodes (AUDC +3.6%) is making new 52-week highs. The company announced this morning it has over 70 partners for a program that simplifies the joint implementation of AudioCodes' hardware/software and Microsoft Lync, but investors have generally been looking for an excuse to buy since the Oracle-Acme Packet deal raised M&A hopes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +9.7%) rip higher to reach 3-month highs after a SEC filing (13G)...

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +9.7%) rip higher to reach 3-month highs after a SEC filing (13G) reveals that BlackRock upped its stake to 7.85% last week
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • MTGE

    American Capital Mortgage (MTGE +4.5%) gains after Friday evening's earnings. The $25.74 Dec. 31 book value is up $0.53 from Q3, with share repurchases accounting for $0.02 of that.   • NVO

    Novo Nordisk (NYSE:NVO) shares plunge 11.85% premarket after the FDA unexpectedly rejected the...

    Novo Nordisk (NYSE:NVO) shares plunge 11.85% premarket after the FDA unexpectedly rejected the company's Tresiba long-acting insulin and a related product called Ryzodeg. The FDA requested more data from a dedicated cardiovascular outcomes trial, which Novo doesn't expect to be able to provide this year. Tresiba and Ryzodeg are approved in Europe and Japan, and are forecast to generate billions of dollars of sales - assuming U.S. approval.
